titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Sheri Martinelli Papers
titlestmt.author: Beinecke staff

publicationstmt.publisher: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Tuesday April 23, 2019 at 04:22

repository.corpname: Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library

did.abstract: Correspondence, writings, artwork and objects, printed material, and sound recordings documenting the life and creative work of Sheri Martinelli and associated figures, including Ezra Pound. The correspondence includes Martinelli's letters with Pound, the poet H. D., and Charles Bukowski, as well as many other literary and artistic figures. The writings include selections of Pound's manuscript material from the Cantos, as well as Martinelli's extensive notes and notebooks. Paintings, sketches, ceramics, and etchings are present, as are two volumes of the Cantos, illustrated by Martinelli and housed in painted boxes, and extensive printed material containing Martinelli's illustrations and annotations. The sound recordings include over 1600 audiocassettes, microcassettes, and reel-to-reel tapes of recordings made by Martinelli's.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.
Boxes 3, 138-144 (reel-to-reel tapes): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Boxes 62-136 (audiocassettes): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.
Box 137 (microcassettes): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The Sheri Martinelli Papers is the physical property of the Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library, Yale University. Literary rights, including copyright, belong to the authors or their legal heirs and assigns. For further information, consult the appropriate curator.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Sheri Martinelli Papers. Yale Collection of American Literature, Beinecke Rare Book and Manuscript Library.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Sheri Martinelli (1918-1996), artist and poet, was born in Philadelphia and studied ceramics at the Philadelphia School of Industrial Arts. Martinelli later expanded her artistic repertoire to include abstract painting and engraving. She became an associate of Anais Nin and William Gaddis in 1945 and met Ezra Pound in 1951 or 1952 while he was incarcerated at St. Elizabeth's Hospital in Washington, D. C. They maintained a relationship until 1956, and she provided him with inspiration for his work, including the Cantos, while he provided her with instruction in painting; he published a small booklet compilation of her work, La Martinelli, in 1956. She relocated to San Francisco in the late 1950s and began publishing the Anagogic & Paideumic Review, a literary periodical that published primarily Beat poetry, as well as poems by Charles Bukowski. Martinelli relocated to Virginia in 1984 and spent the rest of her life organizing the Pound-related papers in her possession.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into three groupings: June 1977 Acquisition, August 1999 Acquisition, and August 1999 Acquisition Addition.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection received a basic level of processing in 2014, including rehousing and in some instances minimal organization. Various acquisitions associated with the collection have not been merged and organized as a whole. Each acquisition is described separately in the contents list below, identified by a unique call number and titled according to month and year of acquisition.

The finding aid for this collection is compiled from individual preliminary lists for each acquisition that were created at or around the time of receipt by the library. The preliminary lists were migrated to comply with current archival descriptive standards and merged into a single file in 2007-2008. As part of the migration, modifications were made to the formatting of individual lists; however, the content of the lists was neither modified nor verified.

As a rule, descriptive information found in the Collection Contents section is drawn in large part from information supplied with the collection and from an initial survey of the contents. Folder titles appearing in the contents list below are often based on those provided by the creator or previous custodian. Titles have not been verified against the contents of the folders in all cases. Otherwise, folder titles are supplied by staff during initial processing.
This finding aid may be updated periodically to account for new acquisitions to the collection and/or revisions in arrangement and description.
Former call numbers: Uncat ZA MS 164 and Uncat ZA MS 643.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, writings, artwork and objects, printed material, and sound recordings documenting the life and creative work of Sheri Martinelli and associated figures, including Ezra Pound. The correspondence includes Martinelli's letters with Pound, the poet H. D., and Charles Bukowski, as well as many other literary and artistic figures. The writings include selections of Pound's manuscript material from the Cantos, as well as Martinelli's extensive notes and notebooks. Paintings, sketches, ceramics, and etchings are present, as are two volumes of the Cantos, illustrated by Martinelli and housed in painted boxes, and extensive printed material containing Martinelli's illustrations and annotations. The sound recordings include over 1600 audiocassettes, microcassettes, and reel-to-reel tapes of recordings made by Martinelli.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Sheri Martinelli, 1977 and purchased from Gilbert Lee, 1999.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Former call number: Uncat ZA MS 164

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, notes, printed material, and a reel-to-reel tape documenting the relationship of Sheri Martinelli and Ezra Pound.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Box 3 (Reel to reel tape): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Former call number: Uncat Za MS 643

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into seven series: I. Correspondence, 1938-1999. II. Writings and Research Files, 1937-1993. III. Artwork, 1925-1963. IV. Objects, 1957-1967. V. Books Annotated and Illustrated by Sheri Martinelli, 1905-1976. VI. Audiocassettes and Microcassettes, 1979-1993. VII. Reel-to-Reel Recordings, 1954-1976.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Gilbert Lee on the Ezra Pound Archive Fund, 1999.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, including Martinelli's letters with Pound, the poet H. D., and Charles Bukowski, and many others; Pound's manuscript material for the Cantos and Martinelli's notes; Martinelli's artwork; and over 1600 audiocassettes, microcassettes, and reel-to-reel tapes of Martinelli's recordings.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The illustrated copies of the Cantos are housed in two handmade wooden boxes with some additional illustrations created and painted by Sheri Martinelli.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: 9 panel drawings etched and or painted on wood, varnished. Signed by Sheri Martinelli with her monogram in the lower right corner and dated 1959.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Primarily consists of clay and ceramic sculptures and tiles, and objects belonging to or made by Sheri Martinelli. Photographic surrogates of the objects in this series are available in box 57.

did.unittitle: "Venus," clay figure in the round, in three pieces

scopecontent.p: Consists of: "Children dancing," 4 tiles made by Po Li for Sheri Martinelli, one broken; woman and child on 1 plaster and 1 clay tile; "Isis" 2 green tiles; and 5 small ceramic tray/tiles, one broken

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Books contain annotations, drawings, illustrations, botanical specimens and ephemera of or created by Sheri Martinelli.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Boxes 138-144 (reel to reel tapes): Restricted fragile material. Reference copies may be requested. Consult Access Services for further information

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Former call number: Uncat Za MS 643

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Purchased from Gilbert Lee on the Ezra Pound Archive Fund, 1999.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, notes, and printed material related to Sheri Martinelli.

did.unittitle: Letters, notes, printed ephemera, clippings, by or relating to Sheri Martinelli
